    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AuditMon(java.lang.String session)
      Creates a named AuditMon session By default this constructor registers selection listeners Assumes no journaling
      AuditMon(java.lang.String session, boolean registerSelectionListener)
      Creates a named AuditMon session This constructor provides functionality to prevent registration of selection listeners Assumes no journaling
      AuditMon(java.lang.String session, java.lang.String journalFilePath)
      Creates a named AuditMon session By default this constructor registers selection listeners
      AuditMon(java.lang.String session, java.lang.String journalFilePath, boolean registerSelectionListener)
      Creates a named AuditMon session This constructor provides functionality to prevent registration of selection listeners

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearObservationFilter()
      Removes any observation filters, this AuditMon instance will observe selections from anywhere in the universe.
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.db.graph.GraphElement findFirstObservationNodeForSession(java.lang.String session)
      Finds the first observation node for the given session or returns null if none exists
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.db.graph.GraphElement findLastObservationEdgeForSession(java.lang.String session)
      Finds the last observation edge for the given session or returns null if none exists
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.db.graph.GraphElement findLastObservationNodeForSession(java.lang.String session)
      Finds the last observation node for the given session or returns null if none exists
      static com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.db.graph.GraphElement findObservationNode(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q nodes)
      Finds a observation node that has member edges to each and only every GE in the node set Returns null if no observation node exists
      com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q getLastObservation()
      Returns the last observation node as a Q
      java.lang.String getSessionName()
      Returns the name of this AuditMon session
      boolean isJournalingEnabled()
      Returns true if journaling is enabled for this audit session
      boolean isMonitoring()
      Returns a boolean true if the AuditMon session is observing observations
      void makeObservation(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q observation)
      Records an observation of the given set of nodes in the index for the current session This observation origin defaults to "manual"
      void makeObservation(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q observation, java.lang.Long timestamp, java.lang.String origin)
      Records an observation of the given set of nodes in the index for the current session If edges are present in the Q then the observation will include both nodes defining the edge
      void makeObservation(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q observation, java.lang.String origin)
      Records an observation of the given set of nodes in the index for the current session
      void registerIndexListener()
      Registers the index listener
      void registerSelectionListener()
      Registers the index listener
      void restoreSession(java.lang.String session)
      Forces a restoration of the current session from the index This method should be called after any third party modifications to the index that involve observation nodes or edges
      void saveIndex()
      Updates the current index
      void saveIndex(java.lang.String path)
      Saves a copy of the index to the given path
      void setObservationFilter(com.ensoftcorp.atlas.core.query.Q context)
      Sets a context filter so that this AuditMon instance only makes observations if the observation is completely contained in the given context.
      boolean start()
      Enables observation monitoring Returns boolean true if monitoring was successfully started
      boolean start(java.lang.Long timestamp)
      Enables observation monitoring Returns boolean true if monitoring was successfully started
      void stop()
      Stops monitoring for observations and inserts a stop node with the reason of "stop" This method unconditionally stops audit monitoring (if it is currently monitoring)
      void stop(java.lang.Long timestamp, java.lang.String reason)
      Stops monitoring for observations and inserts a stop node with the given reason and timestamp This method unconditionally stops audit monitoring observation events (if it is currently monitoring)
      void stop(java.lang.String reason)
      Stops monitoring for observations and inserts a stop node with the given reason This method unconditionally stops audit monitoring (if it is currently monitoring)
      void unregisterIndexListener()
      Unregisters the index listener
      void unregisterSelectionListener()
      Unregisters the index listener
